intro: Boerhavia diffusa var. eurepens, commonly known as spreading hogweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Nyctaginaceae. It is native to regions of Asia, Africa, and Australia, and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit with fleshy, hairy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in racemose inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often covered with fine hairs. Boerhavia diffusa var. eurepens is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both wet and dry conditions.
